intro: Dicksonia consanguinea, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and a crown of pinnate, dark green fronds. The plant belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is known for its ability to grow in shaded, moist environments. Its rhizome is thick and fibrous, supporting its tall stature. The fronds are typically narrow and elongated, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
